intro: Colysis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf colysis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Colysis lanceolata is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
